intro: Vilfa roxburghiana, commonly known as the Himalayan vilfa, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, often blooming in late summer. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
